intro: Meconella collina, commonly known as the mountain meconella, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate to cold climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while the flowers are small and clustered in a head. Meconella collina is often found in alpine regions and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
